titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Religion at LSU
titleInfo.subTitle: Patrick Mascarella oral history interview, 1992

name.description: Priest at Christ the King Chapel, on the Louisiana State University Campus, Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

subject.topic: Christ the King Parish (Baton Rouge, La.)

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Interview concerns Fr. Mascarella's ministry at Christ the King Chapel. Interview includes his relations with the Claretians (a religious order), Fr. Michael Cody, Fr. Richard Greene, and Bishop Joseph V. Sullivan. Topics include the dismissal of the Claretians at Christ the King, student involvement at Christ the King, role of the Catholic student center, and the establishment of a religious studies department at LSU.
